verses.verse: Now <S%G3767><s%> when Festus <S%G5347><s%> was come <S%G1910><s%> into the province, <S%G1885><s%> after <S%G3326><s%> three <S%G5140><s%> days <S%G2250><s%> he ascended <S%G305><s%> from Caesarea <S%G2542><s%> to Jerusalem. <S%G2414><s%>

Then <S%G1161><s%> the high <S%G749><s%> priest <S%G749><s%> and the chief <S%G4413><s%> of the Jews <S%G2453><s%> informed <S%G1718><s%> him against <S%G2596><s%> Paul, <S%G3972><s%> and sought <S%G3870><s%> him,

And desired <S%G154><s%> favor <S%G5485><s%> against <S%G2596><s%> him, that he would send <S%G3343><s%> for him to Jerusalem, <S%G2419><s%> laying <S%G4160><s%> wait <S%G4160><s%> <S%G1747><s%> in the way <S%G3598><s%> to kill <S%G337><s%> him.

But Festus <S%G5347><s%> answered, <S%G611><s%> that Paul <S%G3972><s%> should be kept <S%G5083><s%> at <S%G1722><s%> Caesarea, <S%G2542><s%> and that he himself <S%G1438><s%> would <S%G3195><s%> depart <S%G1607><s%> shortly <S%G1722><s%> <S%G5034><s%> thither.

Let them therefore, <S%G3767><s%> said <S%G5346><s%> he, which among <S%G1722><s%> you are able, <S%G1415><s%> go <S%G4782><s%> down <S%G4782><s%> with me, and accuse <S%G2723><s%> this <S%G846><s%> man, <S%G435><s%> if <S%G1487><s%> there be any <S%G1536><s%> wickedness <S%G824><s%> in him.

And when he had tarried <S%G1304><s%> among <S%G1722><s%> them more <S%G4119><s%> than <S%G2228><s%> ten <S%G1176><s%> days, <S%G2250><s%> he went <S%G2597><s%> down <S%G2597><s%> to Caesarea; <S%G2542><s%> and the next <S%G1887><s%> day <S%G1887><s%> sitting <S%G2523><s%> on <S%G1909><s%> the judgment <S%G968><s%> seat <S%G968><s%> commanded <S%G2753><s%> Paul <S%G3972><s%> to be brought. <S%G71><s%>

And when he was come, <S%G3854><s%> the Jews <S%G2453><s%> which came <S%G2597><s%> down <S%G2597><s%> from Jerusalem <S%G2414><s%> stood <S%G4026><s%> round <S%G4026><s%> about, <S%G3936><s%> and laid <S%G5342><s%> many <S%G4183><s%> and grievous <S%G926><s%> complaints <S%G157><s%> against <S%G2596><s%> Paul, <S%G3972><s%> which <S%G3588><s%> they could <S%G2480><s%> not prove. <S%G584><s%>

While he answered <S%G626><s%> for himself, Neither <S%G3777><s%> against <S%G1519><s%> the law <S%G3551><s%> of the Jews, <S%G2453><s%> neither <S%G3777><s%> against <S%G1519><s%> the temple, <S%G2411><s%> nor <S%G3777><s%> yet against <S%G1519><s%> Caesar, <S%G2541><s%> have I offended <S%G264><s%> any <S%G5100><s%> thing at all.

But Festus, <S%G5347><s%> willing <S%G2309><s%> to do <S%G2698><s%> the Jews <S%G2453><s%> a pleasure, <S%G5485><s%> answered <S%G611><s%> Paul, <S%G3972><s%> and said, <S%G2036><s%> Will you go <S%G305><s%> up to Jerusalem, <S%G2414><s%> and there <S%G1563><s%> be judged <S%G2919><s%> of these <S%G5130><s%> things before <S%G1909><s%> me?

Then <S%G1161><s%> said <S%G2036><s%> Paul, <S%G3972><s%> I stand <S%G2476><s%> at <S%G1909><s%> Caesar's <S%G2541><s%> judgment <S%G968><s%> seat, <S%G968><s%> where <S%G3757><s%> I ought <S%G1163><s%> to be judged: <S%G2919><s%> to the Jews <S%G2453><s%> have I done <S%G91><s%> no <S%G3762><s%> wrong, <S%G91><s%> as you very <S%G2566><s%> well <S%G2573><s%> know. <S%G1921><s%>

For if <S%G1487><s%> I be an offender, <S%G91><s%> or <S%G2532><s%> have committed <S%G4238><s%> any <S%G5100><s%> thing worthy <S%G514><s%> of death, <S%G2288><s%> I refuse <S%G3868><s%> not to die: <S%G599><s%> but if <S%G1487><s%> there be none <S%G3762><s%> of these things whereof <S%G3739><s%> these <S%G3778><s%> accuse <S%G2723><s%> me, no <S%G3762><s%> man <S%G3762><s%> may <S%G1410><s%> deliver <S%G5483><s%> me to them. I appeal <S%G1941><s%> to Caesar. <S%G2541><s%>

Then <S%G5119><s%> Festus, <S%G5347><s%> when he had conferred <S%G4814><s%> with the council, <S%G4824><s%> answered, <S%G611><s%> Have you appealed <S%G1941><s%> to Caesar? <S%G2541><s%> to Caesar <S%G2541><s%> shall you go. <S%G4198><s%>

And after <S%G1230><s%> certain <S%G5100><s%> days <S%G2250><s%> king <S%G935><s%> Agrippa <S%G67><s%> and Bernice <S%G959><s%> came <S%G2658><s%> to Caesarea <S%G2542><s%> to salute <S%G782><s%> Festus. <S%G5347><s%>

And when <S%G5613><s%> they had been <S%G1304><s%> there <S%G1563><s%> many <S%G4119><s%> days, <S%G2250><s%> Festus <S%G5347><s%> declared <S%G394><s%> Paul's <S%G3972><s%> cause <S%G3588><s%> <S%G2596><s%> to the king, <S%G935><s%> saying, <S%G3004><s%> There is a certain <S%G5100><s%> man <S%G435><s%> left <S%G2641><s%> in bonds <S%G1198><s%> by Felix: <S%G5344><s%>

About <S%G4012><s%> whom, <S%G3739><s%> when I was at <S%G1519><s%> Jerusalem, <S%G2414><s%> the chief <S%G749><s%> priests <S%G749><s%> and the elders <S%G4245><s%> of the Jews <S%G2453><s%> informed <S%G1718><s%> me, desiring <S%G154><s%> to have judgment <S%G1349><s%> against <S%G2596><s%> him.

To whom <S%G3739><s%> I answered, <S%G611><s%> It is not the manner <S%G1485><s%> of the Romans <S%G4514><s%> to deliver <S%G5483><s%> any <S%G5100><s%> man <S%G444><s%> to die, <S%G684><s%> before <S%G4250><s%> that he which is accused <S%G2723><s%> have <S%G2192><s%> the accusers <S%G2725><s%> face <S%G4383><s%> to face, <S%G4383><s%> and have <S%G2983><s%> license <S%G5117><s%> to answer <S%G627><s%> for himself concerning <S%G4012><s%> the crime <S%G1462><s%> laid <S%G1462><s%> against him.

Therefore, <S%G3767><s%> when they were come <S%G4905><s%> here, <S%G1759><s%> without <S%G3367><s%> <S%G4160><s%> any <S%G3362><s%> delay <S%G311><s%> on <S%G1909><s%> the morrow <S%G1836><s%> I sat <S%G2523><s%> on <S%G1909><s%> the judgment <S%G968><s%> seat, <S%G968><s%> and commanded <S%G2753><s%> the man <S%G435><s%> to be brought <S%G71><s%> forth.

Against <S%G4012><s%> whom <S%G3739><s%> when the accusers <S%G2725><s%> stood <S%G2476><s%> up, they brought <S%G2018><s%> none <S%G3762><s%> accusation <S%G156><s%> of such things as I supposed: <S%G5282><s%>

But had <S%G2192><s%> certain <S%G5100><s%> questions <S%G2213><s%> against <S%G4314><s%> him of their own <S%G2398><s%> superstition, <S%G1175><s%> and of one <S%G5100><s%> Jesus, <S%G2424><s%> which was dead, <S%G2348><s%> whom <S%G3739><s%> Paul <S%G3972><s%> affirmed <S%G5335><s%> to be alive. <S%G2198><s%>

And because I doubted <S%G639><s%> of such manner <S%G4012><s%> of questions, <S%G2214><s%> I asked <S%G3004><s%> him whether <S%G1487><s%> he would go <S%G4198><s%> to Jerusalem, <S%G2419><s%> and there <S%G1563><s%> be judged <S%G2919><s%> of these <S%G5130><s%> matters.

But when Paul <S%G3972><s%> had appealed <S%G1941><s%> to be reserved <S%G5083><s%> to the hearing <S%G1233><s%> of Augustus, <S%G828><s%> I commanded <S%G2753><s%> him to be kept <S%G5083><s%> till <S%G2193><s%> I might send <S%G3992><s%> him to Caesar. <S%G2541><s%>

Then <S%G1161><s%> Agrippa <S%G67><s%> said <S%G5346><s%> to Festus, <S%G5347><s%> I would also <S%G2532><s%> hear <S%G191><s%> the man <S%G444><s%> myself. To morrow, <S%G839><s%> said <S%G5346><s%> he, you shall hear <S%G191><s%> him.

And on the morrow, <S%G1887><s%> when Agrippa <S%G67><s%> was come, <S%G2064><s%> and Bernice, <S%G959><s%> with great <S%G4183><s%> pomp, <S%G5325><s%> and was entered <S%G1525><s%> into <S%G1519><s%> the place <S%G201><s%> of hearing, <S%G201><s%> with the chief <S%G5506><s%> captains, <S%G5506><s%> and principal <S%G3588><s%> <S%G2596><s%> <S%G1851><s%> <S%G5607><s%> men <S%G435><s%> of the city, <S%G4172><s%> at Festus' <S%G5347><s%> commandment <S%G2753><s%> Paul <S%G3972><s%> was brought <S%G71><s%> forth.

And Festus <S%G5347><s%> said, <S%G5346><s%> King <S%G935><s%> Agrippa, <S%G67><s%> and all <S%G3956><s%> men <S%G435><s%> which <S%G3588><s%> are here <S%G4840><s%> present <S%G4840><s%> with us, you see <S%G2334><s%> this <S%G5126><s%> man, about <S%G4012><s%> whom <S%G3739><s%> all <S%G3956><s%> the multitude <S%G4128><s%> of the Jews <S%G2453><s%> have <S%G2983><s%> dealt <S%G1793><s%> with me, both <S%G5037><s%> at <S%G1722><s%> Jerusalem, <S%G2414><s%> and also here, <S%G1759><s%> crying <S%G1916><s%> that he ought <S%G1163><s%> not to live <S%G2198><s%> any <S%G3371><s%> longer. <S%G3371><s%>

But when I found <S%G2638><s%> that he had committed <S%G4238><s%> nothing <S%G3367><s%> worthy <S%G514><s%> of death, <S%G2288><s%> and that he himself <S%G848><s%> has appealed <S%G1941><s%> to Augustus, <S%G828><s%> I have <S%G2983><s%> determined <S%G2919><s%> to send <S%G3992><s%> him.

Of whom <S%G3739><s%> I have <S%G2192><s%> no <S%G3756><s%> certain <S%G804><s%> thing to write <S%G1125><s%> to my lord. <S%G2962><s%> Why <S%G1352><s%> I have brought <S%G4254><s%> him forth <S%G4254><s%> before <S%G1909><s%> you, and specially <S%G3122><s%> before <S%G1909><s%> you, O king <S%G935><s%> Agrippa, <S%G67><s%> that, after examination <S%G351><s%> had, <S%G1096><s%> I might have <S%G2192><s%> somewhat <S%G5100><s%> to write. <S%G1125><s%>

For it seems <S%G1380><s%> to me unreasonable <S%G249><s%> to send <S%G3992><s%> a prisoner, <S%G1198><s%> and not with to signify <S%G4591><s%> the crimes <S%G156><s%> laid against <S%G2596><s%> him.
